items.title: Jerry and David’s Guide to the Web Launches
items.description: Jerry Yang and David Filo, two Stanford Ph.D. candidates working in a campus trailer, create Jerry and David's Guide to the World Wide Web. Originally it is a way to keep track of their personal interests on the Internet.

items.title: Yahoo! Is Born
items.description: After expanding to 100 web pages in a month, Jerry and David's Guide to the World Wide Web is renamed 'Yahoo!'. The name is a backronym for 'Yet Another Hierarchical Officious Oracle.'

items.title: First Yahoo! News story
items.description: The death of Jerry Garcia was the first Yahoo! news story ever posted.

items.title: Our First Ads
items.description: Yahoo! begins serving ads.

items.title: The Yahoo! logo is unveiled
items.description: The need for a Yahoo! logo emerged as Jerry and David's Guide to the World Wide Web became a real live startup. After several early incarnations, the (originally red) Yahoo! logo we know today was launched formally on Yahoo! on January 1, 1996.

items.title: Y! Goes Public
items.description:
Opening bit was $13 per share. 
Stock closed at $33 per share that day.

items.title: Yahoo!'s First TV Commercial Airs
items.description: If this is the 'fish' commercial, the connections editorial (formerly 'surfing') department has the fish from that commercial. This is also the first time the 'Do You Yahoo!?' tagline is introduced.

items.title: My Yahoo! Debuts
items.description: Yahoo! makes the Web even more personal. More 14 years later, MyYahoo is still No. 1 in its category.

items.title: One Billion Page Views
items.description: Yahoo!'s traffic reaches one billion page views.

items.title: David and Jerry's Holiday Gift
items.description: As a gesture for the holidays, David and Jerry bring espresso machines and baristas to Yahoo!

items.title: S&P 500 Index
items.description: Yahoo! is added to the S&P 500 index.

items.title: San Francisco Historical Sign
items.description: Yahoo sign with lights all around - can be seen when driving up 101 Freeway.

items.title: Y2K Party and Y2K Bug
items.description: Y2K party at Yahoo! since all employees had to be here just in case anything crashed (fear of the Y2K bug). Their families were invited as well.

items.title: Sunnyvale Campus Opens
items.description: Yahoo!'s Sunnyvale headquarters opens.

items.title: Y!'s Respond to 9/11 Disasters
items.description: We had buttons all over the site for people to donate to the Red Cross and other organizations. People hugely used Y! to locate friends and family. Had a way for people to create virtual tiles.

items.title: Yahoo! Acquires Overture
items.description: Yahoo!'s acquisition of Overture, a global leader in commerical search services on the Internet, created the largest global player in the Internet advertising sector. This acquisition combined assets capable of generating, distributing and monetizing search results, ultimlately leading Yahoo! to the development of many crucial search advertising patents.

items.title: Yodeler Crowned
items.description: Yahoo! Yodel Challenge Crowns America's Favorite Amateur Yodeler

items.title: Yodel World Record
items.description: Yahoo! breaks the Guiness World Record for largest group yodel: 1,773 yodelers.

items.title: Yahoo! Search Launched
items.description: Yahoo! Search, a proprietary algorithmic search technology, which was launched during 2004. Yahoo! Search provides users with a comprehensive and highly relevant personalized online search experience and free Internet search results prioritized based on relevance to the user’s search query.

items.title: Yahoo! Launches Developer Network.
items.description: Yahoo! Launches a developer network, giving an API to most of its search verticals.

items.title: Yahoo! Celebrates 10th Birthday
items.description: Yahoo! Celebrates turning 10 years old! Big party in Sunnyvale.

items.title: Yahoo! Acquires Flickr
items.description: Yahoo! acquires photo sharing service Flickr.

items.title: Yahoo!, Alibaba, and Yahoo! China
items.description: Yahoo! Acquires 40% of Alibaba.com and they take over operation of Yahoo! China.

items.title: Yahoo! Hosts an Open Hack Day
items.description: A two day event featuring musical guest Beck.

items.title: Smart Ads
items.description: Smart Ads Raise the industry bar in display advertising.

items.title: Yahoo! Celebrates 15th Birthday
items.description: For Yahoo!'s 15th birthday, a 3D painting was created and placed in URLs Café in building C.

items.title: Yahoo! Supports Japan Tsunami Relief.
items.description: Yahoo! Responds to Disaster in Japan, Raises Over $3.3 million in 5 Days. The disaster relief outreach has been a truly global effort. Yahoo! Taiwan, Korea, Singapore, India, Philippines, Hong Kong, Canada, and Brazil have all featured ways to help on their properties.

items.title: Yahoo! Launches Social Bar
items.description: Yahoo launches Social Bar - where your friends are now the special editors of Yahoo!

items.title: Marissa Mayer joins Yahoo! as CEO
